ayahArV1: ۞ وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ مِن جُندٍ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ
ayahArV2: وما انزلنا على قومه من بعده من جند من السماء وما كنا منزلين
ayahEn: We did not send any soldiers from the heavens against his people after his death, nor did We need to.

ayahArV1: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ خَـٰمِدُونَ
ayahArV2: ان كانت الا صيحة واحدة فاذا هم خامدون
ayahEn: All it took was one ˹mighty˺ blast, and they were extinguished at once.

ayahArV1: يَـٰحَسْرَةً عَلَى ٱلْعِبَادِ ۚ مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
ayahArV2: يا حسرة على العباد ما ياتيهم من رسول الا كانوا به يستهزئون
ayahEn: Oh pity, such beings! No messenger ever came to them without being mocked.

ayahArV1: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
ayahArV2: الم يروا كم اهلكنا قبلهم من القرون انهم اليهم لا يرجعون
ayahEn: Have the deniers not considered how many peoples We destroyed before them who never came back to life again?

ayahArV1: وَإِن كُلٌّ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
ayahArV2: وان كل لما جميع لدينا محضرون
ayahEn: Yet they will all be brought before Us.

ayahArV1: وَءَايَةٌ لَّهُمُ ٱلْأَرْضُ ٱلْمَيْتَةُ أَحْيَيْنَـٰهَا وَأَخْرَجْنَا مِنْهَا حَبًّا فَمِنْهُ يَأْكُلُونَ
ayahArV2: واية لهم الارض الميتة احييناها واخرجنا منها حبا فمنه ياكلون
ayahEn: There is a sign for them in the dead earth: We give it life, producing grain from it for them to eat.

ayahArV1: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا جَنَّـٰتٍ مِّن نَّخِيلٍ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍ وَفَجَّرْنَا فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلْعُيُونِ
ayahArV2: وجعلنا فيها جنات من نخيل واعناب وفجرنا فيها من العيون
ayahEn: And We have placed in it gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth in it

ayahArV1: لِيَأْكُلُوا۟ مِن ثَمَرِهِۦ وَمَا عَمِلَتْهُ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
ayahArV2: لياكلوا من ثمره وما عملته ايديهم افلا يشكرون
ayahEn: so that they may eat from its fruit, which they had no hand in making. Will they not then give thanks?

ayahArV1: سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْأَزْوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَمِنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayahArV2: سبحان الذي خلق الازواج كلها مما تنبت الارض ومن انفسهم ومما لا يعلمون
ayahEn: Glory be to the One Who created all ˹things in˺ pairs—˹be it˺ what the earth produces, their genders, or what they do not know!

ayahArV1: وَءَايَةٌ لَّهُمُ ٱلَّيْلُ نَسْلَخُ مِنْهُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظْلِمُونَ
ayahArV2: واية لهم الليل نسلخ منه النهار فاذا هم مظلمون
ayahEn: There is also a sign for them in the night: We strip from it daylight, then—behold!—they are in darkness.

ayahArV1: وَٱلشَّمْسُ تَجْرِى لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَّهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْعَلِيمِ
ayahArV2: والشمس تجري لمستقر لها ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم
ayahEn: The sun travels for its fixed term. That is the design of the Almighty, All-Knowing.

ayahArV1: وَٱلْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَـٰهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَٱلْعُرْجُونِ ٱلْقَدِيمِ
ayahArV2: والقمر قدرناه منازل حتى عاد كالعرجون القديم
ayahEn: As for the moon, We have ordained ˹precise˺ phases for it, until it ends up like an old, curved palm stalk.

ayahArV1: لَا ٱلشَّمْسُ يَنۢبَغِى لَهَآ أَن تُدْرِكَ ٱلْقَمَرَ وَلَا ٱلَّيْلُ سَابِقُ ٱلنَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِى فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
ayahArV2: لا الشمس ينبغي لها ان تدرك القمر ولا الليل سابق النهار وكل في فلك يسبحون
ayahEn: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon, nor does the night outrun the day. Each is travelling in an orbit of their own.

ayahArV1: وَءَايَةٌ لَّهُمْ أَنَّا حَمَلْنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
ayahArV2: واية لهم انا حملنا ذريتهم في الفلك المشحون
ayahEn: Another sign for them is that We carried their ancestors ˹with Noah˺ in the fully loaded Ark

ayahArV1: وَخَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثْلِهِۦ مَا يَرْكَبُونَ
ayahArV2: وخلقنا لهم من مثله ما يركبون
ayahEn: and created for them similar things to ride in.

ayahArV1: وَإِن نَّشَأْ نُغْرِقْهُمْ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنقَذُونَ
ayahArV2: وان نشا نغرقهم فلا صريخ لهم ولا هم ينقذون
ayahEn: If We willed, We could drown them: then no one would respond to their cries, nor would they be rescued—

ayahArV1: إِلَّا رَحْمَةً مِّنَّا وَمَتَـٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
ayahArV2: الا رحمة منا ومتاعا الى حين
ayahEn: except by mercy from Us, allowing them enjoyment for a ˹little˺ while.

ayahArV1: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَمَا خَلْفَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
ayahArV2: واذا قيل لهم اتقوا ما بين ايديكم وما خلفكم لعلكم ترحمون
ayahEn: ˹Still they turn away˺ when it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you ˹in the Hereafter˺ and what is behind you ˹of destroyed nations˺ so you may be shown mercy.”

ayahArV1: وَمَا تَأْتِيهِم مِّنْ ءَايَةٍ مِّنْ ءَايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا مُعْرِضِينَ
ayahArV2: وما تاتيهم من اية من ايات ربهم الا كانوا عنها معرضين
ayahEn: Whenever a sign comes to them from their Lord, they turn away from it.

ayahArV1: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ أَنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَنُطْعِمُ مَن لَّوْ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ أَطْعَمَهُۥٓ إِنْ أَنتُمْ إِلَّا فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayahArV2: واذا قيل لهم انفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين امنوا انطعم من لو يشاء الله اطعمه ان انتم الا في ضلال مبين
ayahEn: And when it is said to them, “Donate from what Allah has provided for you,” the disbelievers say to the believers, “Why should we feed those whom Allah could have fed if He wanted to? You are clearly astray!”

ayahArV1: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayahArV2: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
ayahEn: And they ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

ayahArV1: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً تَأْخُذُهُمْ وَهُمْ يَخِصِّمُونَ
ayahArV2: ما ينظرون الا صيحة واحدة تاخذهم وهم يخصمون
ayahEn: They must be awaiting a single Blast, which will seize them while they are ˹entrenched˺ in ˹worldly˺ disputes.

ayahArV1: فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ تَوْصِيَةً وَلَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
ayahArV2: فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا الى اهلهم يرجعون
ayahEn: Then they will not be able to make a ˹last˺ will, nor can they return to their own people.

ayahArV1: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَنسِلُونَ
ayahArV2: ونفخ في الصور فاذا هم من الاجداث الى ربهم ينسلون
ayahEn: The Trumpet will be blown ˹a second time˺, then—behold!—they will rush from the graves to their Lord.

ayahArV1: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَا مَنۢ بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرْقَدِنَا ۜ ۗ هَـٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَصَدَقَ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
ayahArV2: قالوا يا ويلنا من بعثنا من مرقدنا هذا ما وعد الرحمن وصدق المرسلون
ayahEn: They will cry, “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of rest? This must be what the Most Compassionate warned us of; the messengers told the truth!”

ayahArV1: إِن كَانَتْ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَإِذَا هُمْ جَمِيعٌ لَّدَيْنَا مُحْضَرُونَ
ayahArV2: ان كانت الا صيحة واحدة فاذا هم جميع لدينا محضرون
ayahEn: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will all be brought before Us.

ayahArV1: فَٱلْيَوْمَ لَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayahArV2: فاليوم لا تظلم نفس شيئا ولا تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون
ayahEn: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be rewarded except for what you used to do.

ayahArV1: إِنَّ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ٱلْيَوْمَ فِى شُغُلٍ فَـٰكِهُونَ
ayahArV2: ان اصحاب الجنة اليوم في شغل فاكهون
ayahEn: Indeed, on that Day the residents of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves.

ayahArV1: هُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُهُمْ فِى ظِلَـٰلٍ عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ مُتَّكِـُٔونَ
ayahArV2: هم وازواجهم في ظلال على الارائك متكئون
ayahEn: They and their spouses will be in ˹cool˺ shade, reclining on ˹canopied˺ couches.

ayahArV1: لَهُمْ فِيهَا فَـٰكِهَةٌ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ
ayahArV2: لهم فيها فاكهة ولهم ما يدعون
ayahEn: There they will have fruits and whatever they desire.
And “Peace!” will be ˹their˺ greeting from the Merciful Lord.
˹Then the disbelievers will be told,˺ “Step away ˹from the believers˺ this Day, O  wicked ones!

ayahArV1: ۞ أَلَمْ أَعْهَدْ إِلَيْكُمْ يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوا۟ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
ayahArV2: الم اعهد اليكم يا بني ادم ان لا تعبدوا الشيطان انه لكم عدو مبين
ayahEn: Did I not command you, O  Children of Adam, not to follow Satan, for he is truly your sworn enemy
but to worship Me ˹alone˺? This is the Straight Path.

ayahArV1: وَلَقَدْ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمْ جِبِلًّا كَثِيرًا ۖ أَفَلَمْ تَكُونُوا۟ تَعْقِلُونَ
ayahArV2: ولقد اضل منكم جبلا كثيرا افلم تكونوا تعقلون
ayahEn: Yet he already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not have any sense?
This is the Hell you were warned of.
Burn in it Today for your disbelief.”

ayahArV1: ٱلْيَوْمَ نَخْتِمُ عَلَىٰٓ أَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَتُكَلِّمُنَآ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَتَشْهَدُ أَرْجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
ayahArV2: اليوم نختم على افواههم وتكلمنا ايديهم وتشهد ارجلهم بما كانوا يكسبون
ayahEn: On this Day We will seal their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to what they used to commit.

ayahArV1: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَطَمَسْنَا عَلَىٰٓ أَعْيُنِهِمْ فَٱسْتَبَقُوا۟ ٱلصِّرَٰطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبْصِرُونَ
ayahArV2: ولو نشاء لطمسنا على اعينهم فاستبقوا الصراط فانى يبصرون
ayahEn: Had We willed, We could have easily blinded their eyes, so they would struggle to find their way. How then could they see?

ayahArV1: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَمَسَخْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمْ فَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ مُضِيًّا وَلَا يَرْجِعُونَ
ayahArV2: ولو نشاء لمسخناهم على مكانتهم فما استطاعوا مضيا ولا يرجعون
ayahEn: And had We willed, We could have transfigured them on the spot, so they could neither progress forward nor turn back.

ayahArV1: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرْهُ نُنَكِّسْهُ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ ۖ أَفَلَا يَعْقِلُونَ
ayahArV2: ومن نعمره ننكسه في الخلق افلا يعقلون
ayahEn: And whoever We grant a long life, We reverse them in development. Will they not then understand?

ayahArV1: وَمَا عَلَّمْنَـٰهُ ٱلشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنۢبَغِى لَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ وَقُرْءَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayahArV2: وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له ان هو الا ذكر وقران مبين
ayahEn: We have not taught him poetry, nor is it fitting for him. This ˹Book˺ is only a Reminder and a clear Quran

ayahArV1: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
ayahArV2: لينذر من كان حيا ويحق القول على الكافرين
ayahEn: to warn whoever is ˹truly˺ alive and fulfil the decree ˹of torment˺ against the disbelievers.

ayahArV1: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتْ أَيْدِينَآ أَنْعَـٰمًا فَهُمْ لَهَا مَـٰلِكُونَ
ayahArV2: اولم يروا انا خلقنا لهم مما عملت ايدينا انعاما فهم لها مالكون
ayahEn: Do they not see that We singlehandedly created for them, among other things, cattle which are under their control?

ayahArV1: وَذَلَّلْنَـٰهَا لَهُمْ فَمِنْهَا رَكُوبُهُمْ وَمِنْهَا يَأْكُلُونَ
ayahArV2: وذللناها لهم فمنها ركوبهم ومنها ياكلون
ayahEn: And We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to them, so they may ride some and eat others.

ayahArV1: وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ وَمَشَارِبُ ۖ أَفَلَا يَشْكُرُونَ
ayahArV2: ولهم فيها منافع ومشارب افلا يشكرون
ayahEn: And they derive from them other benefits and drinks. Will they not then give thanks?

ayahArV1: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
ayahArV2: واتخذوا من دون الله الهة لعلهم ينصرون
ayahEn: Still they have taken other gods besides Allah, hoping to be helped ˹by them˺.

ayahArV1: لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَهُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُمْ جُندٌ مُّحْضَرُونَ
ayahArV2: لا يستطيعون نصرهم وهم لهم جند محضرون
ayahEn: They cannot help the pagans, even though they serve the idols as dedicated guards.

ayahArV1: فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ قَوْلُهُمْ ۘ إِنَّا نَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
ayahArV2: فلا يحزنك قولهم انا نعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون
ayahEn: So do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺. Indeed, We ˹fully˺ know what they conceal and what they reveal.

ayahArV1: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayahArV2: اولم ير الانسان انا خلقناه من نطفة فاذا هو خصيم مبين
ayahEn: Do people not see that We have created them from a sperm-drop, then—behold!—they openly challenge ˹Us˺?

ayahArV1: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلًا وَنَسِىَ خَلْقَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ مَن يُحْىِ ٱلْعِظَـٰمَ وَهِىَ رَمِيمٌ
ayahArV2: وضرب لنا مثلا ونسي خلقه قال من يحيي العظام وهي رميم
ayahEn: And they argue with Us—forgetting they were created—saying, “Who will give life to decayed bones?”

ayahArV1: قُلْ يُحْيِيهَا ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنشَأَهَآ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٍ ۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلْقٍ عَلِيمٌ
ayahArV2: قل يحييها الذي انشاها اول مرة وهو بكل خلق عليم
ayahEn: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “They will be revived by the One Who produced them the first time, for He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of every created being.

ayahArV1: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ ٱلْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا فَإِذَآ أَنتُم مِّنْهُ تُوقِدُونَ
ayahArV2: الذي جعل لكم من الشجر الاخضر نارا فاذا انتم منه توقدون
ayahEn: ˹He is the One˺ Who gives you fire from green trees, and—behold!—you kindle ˹fire˺ from them.

ayahArV1: أَوَلَيْسَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يَخْلُقَ مِثْلَهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ ٱلْخَلَّـٰقُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
ayahArV2: اوليس الذي خلق السماوات والارض بقادر على ان يخلق مثلهم بلى وهو الخلاق العليم
ayahEn: Can the One Who created the heavens and the earth not ˹easily˺ resurrect these ˹deniers˺?” Yes ˹He can˺! For He is the Master Creator, All-Knowing.

ayahArV1: إِنَّمَآ أَمْرُهُۥٓ إِذَآ أَرَادَ شَيْـًٔا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
ayahArV2: انما امره اذا اراد شيئا ان يقول له كن فيكون
ayahEn: All it takes, when He wills something ˹to be˺, is simply to say to it: “Be!” And it is!

ayahArV1: فَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
ayahArV2: فسبحان الذي بيده ملكوت كل شيء واليه ترجعون
ayahEn: So glory be to the One in Whose Hands is the authority over all things, and to Whom ˹alone˺ you will ˹all˺ be returned.
By those ˹angels˺ lined up in ranks
and those who diligently drive ˹the clouds˺
and those who recite the Reminder!
Surely your God is One!

ayahArV1: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
ayahArV2: رب السماوات والارض وما بينهما ورب المشارق
ayahEn: ˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, and the Lord of all points of sunrise.

ayahArV1: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
ayahArV2: انا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب
ayahEn: Indeed, We have adorned the lowest heaven with the stars for decoration
and ˹for˺ protection from every rebellious devil.

ayahArV1: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
ayahArV2: لا يسمعون الى الملا الاعلى ويقذفون من كل جانب
ayahEn: They cannot listen to the highest assembly ˹of angels˺ for they are pelted from every side
˹fiercely˺ driven away. And they will suffer an everlasting torment.

ayahArV1: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
ayahArV2: الا من خطف الخطفة فاتبعه شهاب ثاقب
ayahEn: But whoever manages to stealthily eavesdrop is ˹instantly˺ pursued by a piercing flare.

ayahArV1: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍۭ
ayahArV2: فاستفتهم اهم اشد خلقا ام من خلقنا انا خلقناهم من طين لازب
ayahEn: So ask them ˹O Prophet˺, which is harder to create: them or other marvels of Our creation? Indeed, We created them from a sticky clay.
In fact, you are astonished ˹by their denial˺, while they ridicule ˹you˺.
When they are reminded, they are never mindful.
And whenever they see a sign, they make fun of it

ayahArV1: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayahArV2: وقالوا ان هذا الا سحر مبين
ayahEn: saying, “This is nothing but pure magic.

ayahArV1: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
ayahArV2: ااذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما اانا لمبعوثون
ayahEn: When we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be resurrected?
And our forefathers as well?”
Say, “Yes! And you will be fully humbled.”

ayahArV1: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
ayahArV2: فانما هي زجرة واحدة فاذا هم ينظرون
ayahEn: It will only take one Blast, then at once they will see ˹it all˺.

ayahArV2: وقالوا يا ويلنا هذا يوم الدين
ayahEn: They will cry, “Oh, woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!”

ayahArV1: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayahArV2: هذا يوم الفصل الذي كنتم به تكذبون
ayahEn: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is the Day of ˹Final˺ Decision which you used to deny.”

ayahArV1: ۞ ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
ayahArV2: احشروا الذين ظلموا وازواجهم وما كانوا يعبدون
ayahEn: ˹Allah will say to the angels,˺ “Gather ˹all˺ the wrongdoers along with their peers, and whatever they used to worship

ayahArV1: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayahArV2: من دون الله فاهدوهم الى صراط الجحيم
ayahEn: instead of Allah, then lead them ˹all˺ to the path of Hell.
And detain them, for they must be questioned.”
˹Then they will be asked,˺ “What is the matter with you that you can no longer help each other?”
In fact, on that Day they will be ˹fully˺ submissive.
They will turn on each other, throwing blame.

ayahArV1: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayahArV2: قالوا انكم كنتم تاتوننا عن اليمين
ayahEn: The misled will say, “It was you who deluded us away from what is right.”
The misleaders will reply, “No! You disbelieved on your own.

ayahArV1: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَـٰغِينَ
ayahArV2: وما كان لنا عليكم من سلطان بل كنتم قوما طاغين
ayahEn: We had no authority over you. In fact, you yourselves were a transgressing people.

ayahArV1: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
ayahArV2: فحق علينا قول ربنا انا لذائقون
ayahEn: The decree of our Lord has come to pass against us ˹all˺: we will certainly taste ˹the punishment˺.
We caused you to deviate, for we ourselves were deviant.”
Surely on that Day they will ˹all˺ share in the punishment.
That is certainly how We deal with the wicked.

ayahArV1: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
ayahArV2: انهم كانوا اذا قيل لهم لا اله الا الله يستكبرون
ayahEn: For whenever it was said to them ˹in the world˺, “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Allah,” they acted arrogantly

ayahArV1: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
ayahArV2: ويقولون ائنا لتاركو الهتنا لشاعر مجنون
ayahEn: and argued, “Should we really abandon our gods for a mad poet?”
In fact, he came with the truth, confirming ˹earlier˺ messengers.
You will certainly taste the painful torment

ayahArV1: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayahArV2: وما تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون
ayahEn: and will only be rewarded for what you used to do.
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
They will have a known provision:
fruits ˹of every type˺. And they will be honoured
in the Gardens of Bliss
facing each other on thrones.
A drink ˹of pure wine˺ will be passed around to them from a flowing stream:
crystal-white, delicious to drink.

ayahArV1: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
ayahArV2: لا فيها غول ولا هم عنها ينزفون
ayahEn: It will neither harm ˹them˺, nor will they be intoxicated by it.
And with them will be maidens of modest gaze and gorgeous eyes
as if they were pristine pearls.
Then they will turn to one another inquisitively.

ayahArV1: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
ayahArV2: قال قائل منهم اني كان لي قرين
ayahEn: One of them will say, “I once had a companion ˹in the world˺
who used to ask ˹me˺, ‘Do you actually believe ˹in resurrection˺?

ayahArV1: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
ayahArV2: ااذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما اانا لمدينون
ayahEn: When we are dead and reduced to dust and bones, will we really be brought to judgment?’”
He will ˹then˺ ask, “Would you care to see ˹his fate˺?”
Then he ˹and the others˺ will look and spot him in the midst of the Hellfire.
He will ˹then˺ say, “By Allah! You nearly ruined me.

ayahArV1: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
ayahArV2: ولولا نعمة ربي لكنت من المحضرين
ayahEn: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord, I ˹too˺ would have certainly been among those brought ˹to Hell˺.”
˹Then he will ask his fellow believers,˺ “Can you imagine that we will never die

ayahArV1: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
ayahArV2: الا موتتنا الاولى وما نحن بمعذبين
ayahEn: except our first death, nor be punished ˹like the others˺?”
This is truly the ultimate triumph.
For such ˹honour˺ all should strive.

ayahArV1: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
ayahArV2: اذلك خير نزلا ام شجرة الزقوم
ayahEn: Is this ˹bliss˺ a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqûm?
We have surely made it a test for the wrongdoers.

ayahArV1: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayahArV2: انها شجرة تخرج في اصل الجحيم
ayahEn: Indeed, it is a tree that grows in the depths of Hell
bearing fruit like devils’ heads.

ayahArV1: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
ayahArV2: فانهم لاكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون
ayahEn: The evildoers will certainly ˹be left to˺ eat from it, filling up their bellies with it.

ayahArV1: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
ayahArV2: ثم ان لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم
ayahEn: Then on top of that they will be given a blend of boiling drink.
Then they will ultimately return to ˹their place in˺ Hell.
Indeed, they found their forefathers astray
so they rushed in their footsteps!
And surely most of the earlier generations had strayed before them
although We had certainly sent warners among them.
See then what was the end of those who had been warned.
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
Indeed, Noah cried out to Us, and how excellent are We in responding!
We delivered him and his family from the great distress
and made his descendants the sole survivors.
And We blessed him ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations:
“Peace be upon Noah among all peoples.”
Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers.
˹For˺ he was truly one of Our faithful servants.
Then We drowned the others.
And indeed, one of those who followed his way was Abraham.
˹Remember˺ when he came to his Lord with a pure heart

ayahArV1: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
ayahArV2: اذ قال لابيه وقومه ماذا تعبدون
ayahEn: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshipping?
Is it false gods that you desire instead of Allah?
What then do you expect from the Lord of all worlds?”
He later looked up to the stars ˹in contemplation˺
then said, “I am really sick.”
So they turned their backs on him and went away.

ayahArV1: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
ayahArV2: فراغ الى الهتهم فقال الا تاكلون
ayahEn: Then he ˹stealthily˺ advanced towards their gods, and said ˹mockingly˺, “Will you not eat ˹your offerings˺?
What is wrong with you that you cannot speak?”
Then he swiftly turned on them, striking ˹them˺ with his right hand.
Later, his people came rushing towards him ˹furiously˺.
He argued, “How can you worship what you carve ˹with your own hands˺
when it is Allah Who created you and whatever you do?”

ayahArV1: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayahArV2: قالوا ابنوا له بنيانا فالقوه في الجحيم
ayahEn: They said ˹to one another˺, “Build him a furnace and cast him into the blazing fire.”
And so they sought to harm him, but We made them inferior.

ayahArV1: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
ayahArV2: وقال اني ذاهب الى ربي سيهدين
ayahEn: He later said, “I am leaving ˹in obedience˺ to my Lord. He will guide me.
My Lord! Bless me with righteous offspring.”
So We gave him good news of a forbearing son.

ayahArV1: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
ayahArV2: فلما بلغ معه السعي قال يا بني اني ارى في المنام اني اذبحك فانظر ماذا ترى قال يا ابت افعل ما تؤمر ستجدني ان شاء الله من الصابرين
ayahEn: Then when the boy reached the age to work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son! I have seen in a dream that I ˹must˺ sacrifice you. So tell me what you think.” He replied, “O my dear father! Do as you are commanded. Allah willing, you will find me steadfast.”
Then when they submitted ˹to Allah’s Will˺, and Abraham laid him on the side of his forehead ˹for sacrifice˺
We called out to him, “O Abraham!

ayahArV1: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
ayahArV2: قد صدقت الرؤيا انا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
ayahEn: You have already fulfilled the vision.” Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers.
That was truly a revealing test.
And We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice
and blessed Abraham ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations:
“Peace be upon Abraham.”
This is how We reward the good-doers.
He was truly one of Our faithful servants.
We ˹later˺ gave him good news of Isaac—a prophet, and one of the righteous.

ayahArV1: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
ayahArV2: وباركنا عليه وعلى اسحاق ومن ذريتهما محسن وظالم لنفسه مبين
ayahEn: We blessed him and Isaac as well. Some of their descendants did good, while others clearly wronged themselves.
And We certainly showed favour to Moses and Aaron
and delivered them and their people from the great distress.
We helped them so it was they who prevailed.
We gave them the clear Scripture
and guided them to the Straight Path.
And We blessed them ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations:
“Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.”
Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers.
They were truly ˹two˺ of Our faithful servants.
And Elias was indeed one of the messengers.
˹Remember˺ when he said to his people, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
Do you call upon ˹the idol of˺ Ba’l and abandon the Best of Creators—
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
But they rejected him, so they will certainly be brought ˹for punishment˺.
But not the chosen servants of Allah.
We blessed him ˹with honourable mention˺ among later generations:
“Peace be upon Elias.”
Indeed, this is how We reward the good-doers.
He was truly one of Our faithful servants.
And Lot was indeed one of the messengers.
˹Remember˺ when We delivered him and all of his family
except an old woman, who was one of the doomed.
Then We ˹utterly˺ destroyed the rest.
You ˹Meccans˺ certainly pass by their ruins day
and night. Will you not then understand?
And Jonah was indeed one of the messengers.
˹Remember˺ when he fled to the overloaded ship.
Then ˹to save it from sinking,˺ he drew straws ˹with other passengers˺. He lost ˹and was thrown overboard˺.
Then the whale engulfed him while he was blameworthy.
Had he not ˹constantly˺ glorified ˹Allah˺

ayahArV1: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
ayahArV2: للبث في بطنه الى يوم يبعثون
ayahEn: he would have certainly remained in its belly until the Day of Resurrection.
